channel.title: Second easiest way to portforward? Any input?
channel.description: Hello, i've tried portforwarding with utorrent and no-ip, and i got it to work fine, but my connection sucks and it just lags every second. but it did work. i'll look up guides for what i need, but what do you guys think is the second easiest way to portforward after utorrent/no-ip? i'm up for almost anything, if the person has to download the source/server or not, but for some reason i dont understand webclients too much. i was following i think ric's guide but i just don't get it :s i'm not super good at this stuff but im willing to try. thanks.

item.title: Second easiest way to portforward? Any input?
item.dc:creator: @me_caveman me caveman
item.description:
@me_caveman wrote:

bily123:

Pretty sure the lag may be just becuase your internet connection is kinda crappy.

yeah i know its crappy. is there another way though like i asked above?

Read full topic
item.source: Second easiest way to portforward? Any input?
